data.description: Hi, I’m Ryan, looking for a Summer 2026 Digital Technologies Intern.Who Am I?I’m passionate about leveraging Carpenter’s rich and diverse data portfolio to uncover meaningful business insights. I enjoy working at the intersection of data, manufacturing, and technology—turning complex information into practical, actionable intelligence that helps the business operate more efficiently and effectively.What Do We Do?Business Unit: Digital The Digital Department at Carpenter Technology partners closely with IT, manufacturing, metallurgy, and business leaders to extract, transform, and analyze data from many enterprise and manufacturing systems. We build scalable data models and generate insights using modern analytics, advanced machine learning, agentic AI, and artificial intelligence technologies to support operational excellence across the organization.Carpenter Technology is a global leader in the development and manufacture of specialty alloys and advanced materials, serving critical industries including aerospace, defense, energy, medical, and transportation. Our digital initiatives directly support these highly complex manufacturing operations by improving quality, reliability, and performance at scale.Ongoing ProjectsOur team is actively working on initiatives such as:Understanding relationships across manufacturing systems to drive quality, throughput, and reliability insights using advanced analytics and AI enabled modelsPreparing and shaping complex data so it can be effectively used by metallurgists, machine operators, and technical leaders, including AI assisted analytical workflowsModeling, integrating, and unifying data across multiple systems to create a consistent, trusted foundation for analytics, machine learning, and agentic AI systemsExploring the use of AI agents and automation technologies to assist with data discovery, monitoring, validation, and insight generationDelivering meaningful, easy to interpret visualizations and AI augmented analytics experiences for complex manufacturing dataYour Role as an InternYou will be a part of a dynamic team, supporting the following tasks:This role is ideal for a student interested in data, analytics, and artificial intelligence who wants practical experience applying modern digital and AI technologies to solve real-world manufacturing challenges. You’ll gain exposure to complex systems, work alongside experienced professionals, and see how data  and AI driven insights directly impact operations at scale.The Digital Intern will contribute to active data and digital initiatives by supporting both technical development and business adoption efforts. Responsibilities include:Assisting with the preparation, validation, and organization of manufacturing and enterprise data for analysis, reporting, and AI use casesHelping build and maintain data assets, documentation, and process artifacts that support analytics, machine learning, and AI driven solutionsOur Value Proposition   -This position will allow you to develop and build expertise in the following core skills:   Adaptability – You will track, prioritize, and drive multiple concurrent projects to success, while working in a fast-paced corporate environment.  Problem Solving – Develop your critical thinking and analytical skills while assessing problems, recommending solutions or next steps and identifying best practices.Active Learner – Ability and appetite to learn quickly is critical as you expand your knowledge and build your skill sets.   Communication – Create effective verbal and written communications in and across project teams. Organize and present results to small and large audiences throughout the organization.   Collaboration – You will work autonomously in small or large teams, many of which are matrixed teams requiring strong partnership skills.  What Do We Require? You must be:Currently enrolled in a bachelor’s degree program majoring in Data Science, Data Engineering, Computer Science, Analytics or a related fieldMinimum 3.0 GPAWilling and able to work on-site at our Reading, PA location.Applicants MUST be US Citizens or Green Card Holders due to Carpenter’s government contracts.The ideal candidate will bring foundational technical skills and a strong interest in modern data, analytics, and AI technologies. Prior experience in all areas is not required, but exposure to the following is a plus:SQL for querying and preparing data from relational data sourcesPython or similar programming languages for data analysis, scripting, or AI experimentationFundamental understanding of data modeling concepts and relational database structuresIntroductory knowledge of analytics, statistics, machine learning, or artificial intelligence conceptsFamiliarity with AI assisted analytics, generative AI, or agent based AI workflows (academic, project, or personal experience)Experience with data visualization or reporting tools such as Power BI or similar platformsExposure to Microsoft Fabric, including concepts such as Lakehouse architectures, data pipelines, warehouses, OneLake, semantic models, or AI enabled capabilities within the Microsoft ecosystemIdeal Candidate CharacteristicsComfortable and willing to work in a heavy machinery / industrial manufacturing environmentAble to collaborate effectively in a team-oriented settingStrong time-management and task prioritization skillsExcellent written and verbal communication abilitiesSelf-motivated, proactive, and eager to learnMeticulous attention to detailPay RangeHourly rates are based on: 1 – Program of study; 2 – Degree type (i.e., Bachelor’s); 3 – Progression in degree (i.e., 1st year, 2nd year, etc.). The range for this position is $22.00 - $25.00 per hour.Commuting/Housing Assistance (If Eligible) Interns who must commute to work from outside the immediate Reading, PA area (over 50 miles one-way), will be paid a one-time lump sum payment of $2,400 (less applicable taxes) as excessive commute allowance. Interns who choose to temporarily relocate from outside the immediate Reading, PA area (moving over 50 miles one-way), will be paid a one-time lump sum payment of $4,800 (less applicable taxes) as a housing allowance. If applicable, this payment would be made during the first payroll cycle, which would be three or four weeks following the internship start date.Carpenters Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and BelongingAt Carpenter Technology, We Are One Company for All.Carpenter Technology has a culture that builds on the different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives of all employees to drive performance. Our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and belonging is woven into our Core Values of dignity and respect for all. By embracing our diverse perspectives, we accelerate the creation of innovative solutions that deliver value to our customers.Carpenter Technology Company offers a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package including life, medical, dental, vision, flexible spending accounts, disability coverage, 401k with company contributions as well as many other options to employees.Carpenter Technology Corporation’s policy is to fully and effectively maintain a program of equal employment opportunity and nondiscrimination for all employees, to employ affirmative action for all protected classes, and to recruit and develop the best qualified persons available regardless of age, race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, political affiliation or any other characteristic protected by law. The Company also will recruit, develop and provide opportunities for qualified persons with disabilities and protected veterans.
